authors: Khaleda Rahman For Daily Mail Australia
description: Kate Gazzard, was running solo through Mooloolah River National Park at Sippy Downs on Wednesday when shew as confronted by a 'naked, middle-aged, heavy set' man.
title: Queensland woman stunned after encountering naked jogger
title_page: Queensland woman stunned after encountering naked jogger | Daily Mail Online
text:
A woman is warning other runners to beware after a naked man came towards her while she was on a morning run in a national park.
Kate Gazzard was running solo through Mooloolah River National Park at Sippy Downs on Wednesday when she was confronted by a 'naked, middle-aged, heavy set' man.
Mrs Gazzard said the man was wearing nothing but a blue cap and running shoes 'but he wasn't out there to run.'
A woman was horrified to be confronted by a naked man while she was running on Wednesday
She turned and ran as fast as she could away from the naked man and called police to report the incident.
'I headed off down a one-way path, came around a bend and a naked middle-aged, heavy set Caucasian man came out of the bush towards me,' she told the Sunshine Coast Daily.
'I turned and think I ran a 5km [personal best] getting out of there.'
Mrs Gazzard said the shocking incident won't stop her running, but she's now looking for a partner to go with and will be armed with a self-defence tool next time.
Kate Gazzard was running solo through Mooloolah River National Park (file photo) at Sippy Downs on Wednesday when she was confronted by the 'naked, middle-aged, heavy set' man
Queensland Police told Daily Mail Australia that they conducted patrols of the area after the reports the man was last seen going towards Claymore Road around 7.40am.
'She said she saw a man who was running through the national park and apparently he was naked,' a police spokesman said.
'Police went out and conducted patrols and found nothing.'
But Darryn Quinn, who runs regularly in the area, said he saw a running naked man around six months ago.
He also said that some women from Lazy Runner have seen the man too.
'It was kind of weird and not one of those things I thought about until I went past,' he told the Sunshine Coast Daily. 'It's all quite peculiar.'
